programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers travel to the latest set of auctions in Fullerton, California, where Jarrod and Brandi compete for a storage unit they need to keep their store afloat.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Items include replica swords signed by Kill Bill actor David Carradine, a first-edition of TS Eliot's Four Quartets, a 1965 Battle of the Bulge board game, and a 1920s radium crock.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The action in the shop focuses on Rick as he gets wound up trying to complete some deals.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A burglar is caught in the car park - and when she is taken inside the Golds get a big surprise.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les hands over a lot of money for an item based on the word of a customer, and later, Ashley makes a discovery that leaves him looking foolish.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A Vegas Pawn Star hauls in a crumbling 1957 Chevy 150 for a much-needed restoration. The American Pickers rock up too, hoping to flog some of their vintage valuables..

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Dale and the team restore a rusty 1920s tyre-changer, and a baseball game from the 1940s is given an urgent makeover.

programme.title: Nightmare in Suburbia
programme.desc: Documentary examining how a wealthy landowner's acrimonious divorce led to murder. In 2011, Adrian Prout finally revealed where his wife's body was buried.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: A look at how Virginia detectives used science and cunning to catch the surprising killer of 16-year-old ballet dancer Meghan Landowski in 2008.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers attend fiercely competitive auctions in Garland, where Moe and Mary find a rare historical artefact.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers visit the Dallas suburb of Addison, where the Rangers find a nautical antique and Jenny uncovers a piece of Hollywood memorabilia.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Guests Jeremy Clarkson, Vic Reeves and Clive Anderson join regular contributor Alan Davies and host Stephen Fry in the quiz show with a difference. Coming under discussion is the ambitious 'E' subject - everything, with the questions so difficult that points are awarded for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Loyiso Gola, Milton Jones, Miles Jupp, Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: QI

Coming under discussion are subjects beginning with 'E', including Europe, with the questions so difficult that points are awarded for the most interesting answers.

Coming under discussion is the ambitious 'E' subject - everything, with the questions so difficult that points are awarded for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Thanks to back flips and rail rides, Tim and Gendle are in BMX bike heaven. With the clock ticking it is down to Joe and the build team to construct the ultimate BMX set-up.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Blanco ends up in the prison hospital, where he fears he is about to shuffle off this mortal coil and entrusts the whereabouts of his stashed fortune to fellow inmate Fletch, who is sharing a ward with him. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates the story of the D-Day landings in June 1944, when the Allies launched the biggest ever amphibious invasion on the beaches of Normandy. Although both sides suffered heavy casualties, it proved to be the turning point in the war against Germany.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The largest and most sophisticated radio telescope on the planet, which draws inspiration from geodesic dome designs and the work of 18th-century engineer Jean Marie Jacquard.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: In an episode originally screened in 1992, the long suffering Scottish detective tries to defend a childhood friend recently released from prison when a series of shootings puts him in the frame for murder. Mark McManus stars as gruff crime buster Jim Taggart, while series regulars Blythe Duff (DS Jackie Reid) and James MacPherson (Mike Jardine) also star. There's also an appearance from Clare Grogan, best known for her work with the band Altered Images and cult TV hit Red Dwarf.

programme.title: Mansfield Park
programme.desc: Part four of six. The Mansfield Theatricals come to an abrupt end when Sir Thomas unexpectedly returns from Antigua. Jane Austen adaptation, starring Sylvestra Le Touzel.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Montford Cottage in Pendle, Lancashire, where she discovers how the haven was created and reveals a few of her own horticultural secrets.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: After a vital discovery at the farm, Stan and Mick feel closer to shoring up their own suspicions about Jeremy. The arrival of Brett, a friend from New Zealand (played by Game of Thrones star Alfie Allen), increases tensions between Jeremy and Julie, while Ann grows ever more alarmed and suspicious of her cousin Jeremy's behaviour, and his handling of the family estate. As preparations for the inquest continue, Stan is concerned that if the bodies are released for cremation, vital evidence will be lost for ever.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef travels through Charente in south-west France, visiting a distillery in the Cognac region, meeting a miller who still uses traditional methods to make award-winning brioche loaves, and following in the Queen Mother's footsteps with a visit to Chateau de Venteuil, home of the De La Rochefoucauld family. Along the way he creates a salad incorporating some of the region's best produce, classic French onion soup and pays homage to the patron saint of pastry chefs with a stunning dessert.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini travels to Ohio to buy a Pierce Arrow, but is forced to pull out of the purchase when the owner backtracks on his decision to sell.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Cameras capture more road-based disasters, including hot rides going up in flames, freaky motorcycle wipeouts, and unsettling 'redneck' car hobbies that defy all logic.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Footage of dramatic road-based clashes, as drivers and pedestrians unleash their rage, creating chaos on the highways. Plus, coverage of a cringe-worthy crossing incident.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A truck crash sends tons of lemons off a bridge onto pedestrians below, a landslide wrecks homes in Brazil, and a snowmobiler is buried by an avalanche.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of a gas leak that triggers a fireball. Plus, a daredevil crashes his all-terrain vehicle during a back-flip, and a pilot-less plane plunges towards a crowd.

programme.desc: The loggers are reminded of the dangers of their work while harvesting a grove of 100 trees.
